questions.question: 1. What type of cells does the blue box indicate? $\\$
2. In the provided scatter plot, which cell type is represented by the cluster in green?
3. Which of the following samples can be analyzed with flow cytometry?
4. Which of the following is an application of flow cytometry?

answers.a: Visualizing the internal structure of cells
answers.b: Measuring the pH of a fluid sample
answers.c: Counting the number of bacteria in a sample
answers.d: Quantifying the amount of protein in a sample

questions.question: 5. Which of the following statements is true about flow cytometry data analysis?

answers.a: The fluorescence intensity of each cell is measured and recorded as a histogram
answers.b: The forward scatter signal is used to measure the size of each cell
answers.c: The side scatter signal is used to measure the granularity of each cell

questions.question: 6. Which of the following methods is used to sort cells or particles in flow cytometry?
7. Why is it important to obtain a single-cell suspension for flow cytometry?

answers.a: To ensure cells are stained properly
answers.b: To allow cells to be analyzed individually

questions.question: 8. What can the data from a flow cytometer be used to determine?

answers.b: The nutrient content of the cell culture
answers.c: The physical and biochemical properties of cells

questions.question: 9. Which sorting mechanism might a flow cytometer use to sort cells?
10. Which of the following is NOT a typical application of flow cytometry?
